summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Eighth Avenue Northwest, from West Forty-fifth Street to West Forty-eighth Street; North and West Forty-sixth Street, from Palatine Avenue to Ninth Avenue Northwest; West Forty-seventh Street and West Forty-eighth Street, each from First Avenue Northwest to Ninth Avenue Northwest; First Avenue Northwest and Baker Avenue, each from West Forty-fifth Street to West Forty-seventh Street; Second Avenue Northwest and Third Avenue Northwest, each from West Forty-fifth Street to West Forty-eighth Street, all in The City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same and providing for all necessary surface drainage, in accordance with Resolution No. 1823 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
